metadata.title: CVE-2017-9301 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
plugins\audio_filter\libmpgatofixed32_plugin.dll in VideoLAN VLC mediaplayer 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalidread and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlc5 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-bin - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-data - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.3-1-1ubuntu1').
